page.title: 15THE OLD RAILWAY
page.content: The South Brent - Kingsbridge branch line was opened in December 1893. It was a great event in the area, all the Loddiswell schoolchildren had a day's holiday and a free tea. The coming of the railway opened up the area with easy access from Woodleigh and Loddiswell to Kingsbridge, Plymouth, Exeter and even London. In some ways travel in and out of the area was easier then than it is now. In 1893 one could leave London at 9am and be at Loddiswell Station at 4.33pm - in time for tea! During the 1950's passenger traffic declined, and in September 1963 the line was closed. The track was soon taken up and sold as scrap, and the line is now only a quiet footpath and farm track, very overgrown in places. A great tourist opportunity to keep the line open for steam was missed.
